questions.question_text: What are two outcomes of ADOM revisions? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Page 227 of the Study Guide 7.2
"Note that an ADOM revision is a snapshot of the entire ADOM and not the changes specific to this policy package."

Page 233 of the Study Guide 7.2
"Warning: Keep in mind that ADOM revisions can significantly increase the size of the configuration backup"

Selected Answer: BC
B and C would be correct

Selected Answer: BC
A. Wrong. That'd be Configuration Revision, not ADOM Revision.
B. Correct.
C. Correct.
D. Wrong. That'd be the Fortimanager backup functionality.

ADOM revisions are different from Configuration revisions. 

Configuration revision is the complete configuration of the managed device, including device-level, policy, and object configuration. 

ADOM revision is policy packages, objects, and VPN console settings in an ADOM.

choices.A: ADOM revisions can save the current state of the whole ADOM.
choices.B: ADOM revisions can save the current state of all policy packages and objects for an ADOM.
choices.D: ADOM revisions can create System Checkpoints for the FortiManager configuration.
choices.C: ADOM revisions can significantly increase the size of the configuration backups.

choices.A: The unused objects that are not tied to the firewall policies locally on FortiGate will be deleted.
choices.C: The unused objects that are not tied to the firewall policies will remain as read-only locally on FortiGate.
choices.D: The unused objects that are not tied to the firewall policies will be installed on FortiGate.
choices.B: The unused objects that are not tied to the firewall policies in the policy package will be deleted from the FortiManager database.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

An administrator is importing a new device to FortiManager and has selected the options shown in the exhibit.
What will happen if the administrator makes the changes and installs the modified policy package on this managed FortiGate?

discussion.content:
A.
Also, you can choose whether to import all configured objects, or only the objects referenced by the current
firewall policies. Regardless of whether you choose to import only policy-dependent objects or all objects, the
system will delete orphan (unused) objects that are not tied to policies locally on FortiGate in the next
installation
Study guide pg 224

Selected Answer: A
FortiManager does not need to keep unused objects during the Import configuration operation. So, the first Policy package installation after the import will not include the unused objects, therefore the unused objects will be deleted on FortiGate after the Policy package installation.

A. Correct.
B. Wrong. Unused objects are not even imported to the Fortimanager so they can’t be deleted from Fortimanager database.
C. Wrong. The import operation does not modify the FortiGate configuration and there’s no such thing as ‘read-only objects’.
D. Wrong. Unused objects are not even imported to the Fortimanager so they won’t be installed on the FortiGate afterwards.

Device Database: all configuration that can be seen under 'Device Manager'.
ADOM Database: all configuration that can be seen under 'Policy & Objects'.

Selected Answer: D
A. Routing (device-level)
B. NSX-T Service Template (device-level)
C. SNMP (device-level)
D. Security profiles (ADOM-level)

questions.question_text: Which configuration setting for FortiGate is part of an ADOM-level database on FortiManager?

choices.C: Trainer must close Student’s workflow session before approving the request.
choices.D: Trainer does not have full rights over this ADOM.
choices.A: Trainer must first create their own workflow session to approve student session.
choices.B: Trainer is not a part of workflow approval group.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A. Wrong. Only the administrator making changes need to create a session.

B. Correct. An administrator must be part of an approval group. Being part of the Super_Admin profile is not enough to approve a session.

C. Wrong. The approval submission automatically unlocks the ADOM.

D. Wrong. Administrators who have the Super_User profile have full access to all ADOMs,

questions.question_text:
An administrator, Trainer, who is assigned the Super_User profile, is trying to approve a workflow session that was submitted by another administrator, Student. However, Trainer is unable to approve the workflow session.
What can prevent an admin account that has Super_User rights over the device from approving a workflow session?

choices.B: The FortiManager replaces the address object to none

discussion.content: The correct answer is C. Devices in the same ADOM for dynamic objects that were not specified for dynamic mapping will be assigned with an IP address from the Object's subnet. Manual page 211

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


An administrator has created a firewall address object that is used in multiple policy packages for multiple FortiGate devices in an ADOM.

After the installation operation is performed, which IP/netmask will be shown on FortiManager for this firewall address object without specify Per-Device Mapping?
